intro: Dryadella mocoana, commonly known as the Mocoan dryad, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Dryadella mocoana is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
